titleStmt.title: N. H. Marks et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2428

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Nelson County: Ky Feb.. 11th 1861
To his Excellency B. Magoffin Gov. of Ky.
Whereas the office of Justice of the peace in District No. 1. county and state aforesaid has become vacant by the resignation of Jas M. Nicholls late Justice of said district,

We the undersigned residents of said Dist. do reccommend to your honor John C Scifres as eligible to said office according to the law of Ky. and request that your Excellency appoint the said John C Scifres to fill out the unexpired term of said office, Should our petition be granted you will confer a favor on us by so doing.

N. H. Marks J P N C
J. W. Courtney
Benj Lee Duncan
Wm Bean
j T d s n
Allen Courtney
Wm Rodes
A. G. Hall
S. T. Hall
Wm Walker
Leo Webb
Wm. M. Wilson
A Birkshead

Nelson Co
J. P.
Dist No 1
Jno. C Scifres
